title: requirment1
description: ETCS shall provide the driver with information to allow him to drive the train safely.

title: requirment2
description: ETCS shall be able to supervise train and shunting movements.

title: requirment3
description: If the supervision is performed by a RBC it shall be possible to prevent movements of a traction unit in its area if not authorised by the RBC.

title: requirment4
description: ETCS is required to be functional to a maximum train speed of 500 km/h.

title: requirment5
description:
The following definitions shall apply for the ETCS application levels:
	
Level 0: ETCS active for limited train control function; trackside not fitted with any train control system or fitted with a train control system for which no STM is available onboard.
	
Level 1: Basic track to train information via intermittent transmission media, e.g. balises. This information can be supported by infill, transmitted via balise, loop or radio.
	
Level 2: Basic track to train and train to track information via continuous transmission media, i.e. radio. The train detection is provided by trackside.
	
Level 3: Same as level 2 except that train integrity is provided by onboard and therefore trackside. train detection is optional.
	
Level STM (Specific Transmission Module): Track to train information provided by national system. Onboard functions provided by national system (STM) in co-operation with onboard ETCS.

title: requirment6
description: It shall be possible to implement one or more of the ETCS application levels on a line.

title: requirment7
description: Trains equipped for ERTMS/ETCS application level 3 shall be able to run on lines equipped with ERTMS/ETCS application level 3, 2, 1 and 0, trains equipped for ERTMS/ETCS application level 2 shall be able to run on lines equipped with ERTMS/ETCS application level 2, 1 and 0 and trains equipped for ERTMS/ETCS application level 1 shall be able to run on lines equipped with ERTMS/ETCS application level 1 and 0.

title: requirment8
description: The current application level shall be indicated on the DMI.

title: requirment9
description: The driver shall acknowledge the level transitions, if requested from trackside. If the driver does not acknowledge after the transition the brake shall be applied. If the driver acknowledges afterwards, the brake can be released

title: requirment10
description: ETCS shall be compatible with existing national systems listed in the CCS TSI such that it does not interfere with the national systems and is not interfered with by the national systems.

title: requirment11
description:
The ETCS trainborne equipment shall be capable of supervising the following operational states:
	
Full Supervision operation
Partial Supervision operation
			
Staff Responsible operation
On Sight operation
Unfitted Line operation
Train Trip operation
Post Trip operation


National operation (STM)
Tandem operation
Multiple operation
Shunting operation
Stand By operation
Reversing operation

title: requirment12
description: Any transition which occurs while the train is moving shall in principle occur automatically.

title: requirment13
description: Transitions which occur while the train is stationary, shall be initiated automatically or manually as appropriate.

title: requirment14
description: If, as a result of an automatic transition, except for transitions to and from National Operation (STM), the responsibility for the driver increases, the ETCS shall seek an acknowledgement from the driver, whether the train is stationary or not.

title: requirment15
description: For transitions to and from National Operation (STM) the ETCS shall request, an acknowledgement by the driver.

title: requirment16
description: In case the transition has to be acknowledged and the driver fails to acknowledge as required, the ETCS shall initiate a brake application

title: requirment17
description: During the transition period between two operational states (including two different national operations) the supervision provided shall at least ensure the same protection provided by the least restrictive state.

title: requirment18
description: If an ETCS equipped train passes a level transition to a line fitted with more than one level, the onboard shall switch to the highest level, according to the priority given by trackside, for which it is equipped.

title: requirment19
description: If an ETCS equipped train passes a level transition to one or more levels for which it is not equipped, ETCS shall initiate a brake application.

title: requirment20
description: The current operational status shall be indicated to the driver on the DMI

title: requirment21
description: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving National values from the trackside to adapt to National requirements

title: requirment22
description: National values shall be applicable to a defined area

title: requirment23
description: Once received onboard the national values shall remain valid even if the onboard equipment is switched off

title: requirment24
description: If the on-board has no valid national values for the current location, default values shall be used by the onboard equipment.

title: requirment25
description: Default values shall be harmonised values, permanently stored in all ERTMS/ETCS on board equipment

title: requirment26
description: At Start Up, the on board equipment shall perform an automatic self-test.

title: requirment27
description: The test shall require no action on the part of the driver.

title: requirment28
description: The DMI shall indicate the result of the self-test.

title: requirment29
description: Train data shall be entered before the on-board ETCS equipment allows train movement.

title: requirment30
description: The driver shall be able to select Train Data Entry on the DMI.

title: requirment31
description: Entering or overwriting data manually by the driver shall be possible but only when stationary.

title: requirment32
description: Train data may be entered automatically from a railway management system or from train memory.

title: requirment33
description: The driver shall be able to consult train data when the train is stationary or moving.

title: requirment34
description: Current train data shall be stored (except at transition to shunting) in the ETCS equipment until the traction unit is not operative.

title: requirment35
description: Stored train data shall be offered to the driver to be confirmed when Data Entry starts.

title: requirment36
description: The system for Train Data Entry shall provide for the input of other data required by STMs connected to ETCS. This may require additional items, not required for ETCS, to be entered.

title: requirment37
description: The entry of driver identification and the selection of the language shall be possible.

title: requirment38
description: The change of driver identification during a journey or a Train Running Number shall be possible

title: requirment39
description: Following successful completion of Train Data Entry, the driver shall be able to perform shunting movements or train movements.

title: requirment40
description:
The following data may be entered manually by the driver or from train memory:

Driver identification
Train identification (train number) STM ready for use
Data required for brake calculation
Maximum train speed
Train length
Status of air tight system
Type of electric power accepted
Data additional required for STM (if any)
International train category
Train gauge
Maximum axle load of the train with a resolution of 0,5 t

title: requirment41
description:
The following data may be entered manually by the driver provided by external sources
:

Driver identification
Train identification (train number) STM ready for use
Data required for brake calculation
Maximum train speed
Train length
Status of air tight system
Type of electric power accepted
Data additional required for STM (if any)
International train category
Train gauge
Maximum axle load of the train with a resolution of 0,5 t

title: requirment42
description: If the onboard fails to contact the RBC when awakening the driver shall be asked to enter the RBC contact details

title: requirment43
description: An ETCS equipped traction unit shall be capable of being moved in Shunting without train data, track data or movement authority.

title: requirment44
description: Transfer to Shunting on driver's selection shall only be possible when stationary.

title: requirment45
description: To prevent unauthorised use of the function permission shall be obtained from the RBC if the train is operating under the control of the RBC.

title: requirment46
description: Permission received shall be indicated to the driver.

title: requirment47
description: It shall be possible to manually select Shunting from Stand By operation, Full Supervision operation or Partial Supervision operation

title: requirment48
description: Automatic transfer to Shunting may be from Full Supervision operation and Partial Supervision operation status at any speed lower than or equal to the supervised shunting speed based on trackside information.

title: requirment49
description: Before authomatic transition to Shunting, ETCS shall request confirmation from the driver.

title: requirment50
description: ETCS shall supervise Shunting operation to a permitted national speed value.

title: requirment51
description: The supervised Shunting speed shall be indicated to the driver on request.

title: requirment52
description: It shall be possible to apply the train trip function, if the shunting movement passes a signal showing "danger for shunting".

title: requirment53
description: Exit from Shunting shall only be possible when the train is stationary.

title: requirment54
description: Exit from Shunting shall take place when the driver selects exit from shunting.

title: requirment55
description: Partial Supervision shall be selected either by the Driver, or by information received from track-to-train transmission.

title: requirment56
description: If acknowledgement is specified the driver shall acknowledge transfer from Full Supervision to Partial Supervision within 5 seconds

title: requirment57
description: Partial Supervision shall be indicated on the DMI.

title: requirment58
description: In Partial Supervision the train shall be supervised according to train speed and distance data available.

title: requirment59
description: The train shall have the capability of being supervised to a ceiling speed.

title: requirment60
description: This ceiling speed shall not be shown continually on the DMI but may be shown momentarily when selected by the driver.

title: requirment61
description: The train shall leave Partial Supervision when the trainborne equipment is not operative any longer, when Shunting is selected or when Full Supervision is available.

title: requirment62
description: It shall be possible to order a train trip when passing a stop signal

title: requirment63
description: Transferring to Full Supervision shall occur automatically when a movement authority and all other necessary information is received through track-to-train transmission.

title: requirment64
description: It shall be possible for the trackside to ask a driver for confirmation about the occupancy of the track ahead before sending a Full Supervision movement authority.

title: requirment65
description: Full Supervision shall provide supervision of speed and distance.

title: requirment66
description: The trainborne equipment shall remain in Full Supervision until the trainborne equipment is not active any longer, when Shunting is selected or when Partial Supervision information is received.

title: requirment67
description: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall be capable of being isolated.

title: requirment68
description: When the ETCS trainborne equipment is isolated, the system shall not show any ETCS information other than the fact that the system is isolated.

title: requirment69
description: Isolation of the ETCS trainborne equipment shall disconnect the ETCS trainborne equipment from the vehicle braking system.

title: requirment70
description: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall be capable of receiving information from the national train control systems by means of the STM.

title: requirment71
description: The DMI shall display or be compatible with information from national train control systems. This may mean displaying the information shown by the national system.

title: requirment72
description: Unfitted operation shall be possible if ordered by trackside

title: requirment73
description: Unfitted operation shall be possible if selected by the driver at start up

title: requirment74
description: The on board shall supervise the train against a ceiling speed

title: requirment75
description:
The ceiling speed value for the unfitted operation is determined by the lower value out of

Maximum train speed
National value for unfitted operation

title: requirment76
description: The onboard shall be capable to switch to another ETCS status when transmitted from trackside

title: requirment77
description: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving track description from the trackside.

title: requirment78
description: It shall be possible to send information on adhesion conditions from trackside.

title: requirment79
description: It shall also be possible, to allow the driver to change the adhesion conditions; in this case information from trackside has priority.

title: requirment80
description: The trackside shall be able to send information for the calculation of speed profiles.

title: requirment81
description: If track data at least to the location where the relevant movement authority ends are not available on-board, the movement authority shall be rejected.

title: requirment82
description: Track to train transmission shall provide the capability to send different speed profiles for specific train categories.

title: requirment83
description: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall supervise the end of movement authority, if this information is available on-board.

title: requirment84
description: The target distance to be displayed on the DMI shall be based on the most restrictive braking curve.

title: requirment85
description: Together with the movement authority, the on board shall be able to receive one or more time-out(s) for certain sections of the movement authority, and shorten the movement authority accordingly when a time out expires.

title: requirment86
description: Using train data and infrastructure data, braking curves shall be calculated taking into account the target information but not the location of vehicles occupying the track.

title: requirment87
description: The ceiling speed level for the movement authority shall be defined as data National Value.

title: requirment88
description: Before entering an occupied track, a driver acknowledgement shall be requested.

title: requirment89
description: The train shall be supervised according to train speed data available.

title: requirment90
description: The train shall, as a minimum, be supervised to a ceiling speed; the supervised speed shall not be shown on the DMI unless selected by the driver.

title: requirment91
description: The target distance shall not be shown on the DMI unless selected by the driver.

title: requirment92
description: On request of the RBC, the driver shall have the possibility to confirm that the track ahead of him until the end of the on sight section is clear

title: requirment93
description: ETCS shall collect all relevant information concerning train and line speed.

title: requirment94
description: ETCS shall calculate the permitted speed for the train for all locations of the authorised movement.

title: requirment95
description: This static train speed profile shall also respect maximum line speed and track speed and special speed levels for special classes of trains.

title: requirment96
description: The ETCS trainborne equipment calculates the static train speed profile on the basis of infrastructure data and train data.

title: requirment97
description: Based on all relevant data, the ETCS shall calculate an emergency braking curve and a service braking curve

title: requirment98
description: Based on all relevant data, the ETCS shall calculate an emergency braking curve and a service braking curve

title: requirment99
description: When changing to a lower speed level, the front end of the train shall respect the dynamic train speed profile.

title: requirment100
description: When changing to a higher speed level the rear end of the train shall respect the static train speed profile.

title: requirment101
description: It shall be possible to define certain locations (e.g. tunnels) where speed increase is related to the front of the train.

title: requirment102
description: The braking curves shall ensure that the train complies with its speed requirements.

title: requirment103
description: Where failure to apply the full service brake is detected the emergency brake shall stop the train in rear of the danger point.

title: requirment104
description:
The release speed shall be calculated on board, based on either:

safety distance and overlap
accuracy of odometry
deceleration performance of the train, etc

or given from the trackside. The release speed given from the trackside shall take priority over the release speed calculated on board.

title: requirment105
description: The release speed shall be indicated on the DMI.

title: requirment106
description: If the release speed is calculated on board it shall ensure that the train will stop before reaching the danger point

title: requirment107
description: When the train is stationary or after a certain time (e.g. the time for "route releasing" of the overlap, the release speed calculation shall be based on the distance to the danger point (if calculated on-board). The condition for this change shall be defined for each target as infrastructure data.

title: requirment108
description: Each railway shall have the possibility of allowing a different release speed for every signal.

title: requirment109
description: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall be able to determine the location of the entire train.

title: requirment110
description: On lines fitted with RBC, the ETCS trainborne equipment shall be able to transmit the location of the entire train to the RBC.

title: requirment111
description: The train location calculation shall take into account error of odometry.

title: requirment112
description: Actual speed shall be indicated on the DMI

title: requirment113
description: There shall be no discrepancy between the speed shown to the driver and the speed used for supervision of movement authorities and speed limits, function 4.3.7

title: requirment114
description: The indication provided shall enable the driver to drive at the permitted speed without receiving a warning and without intervention of ETCS.

title: requirment115
description: The driver shall know the distance to the next point defining the indicated braking curve and the permitted speed allowed. This shall be shown to the driver in a way that is understandable and logical.

title: requirment116
description: Visual and acoustic warnings to the driver about possible intervention from ETCS shall be given to enable the driver to react and avoid intervention.

title: requirment117
description: The driver shall have the possibility to select the language, this does not concern non pre-defined texts sent from the trackside.

title: requirment118
description: A train shall be supervised to its static and dynamic train speed profiles.

title: requirment119
description: Within the braking curve area, a warning shall be given to the driver to enable him to react and avoid intervention from ETCS equipment at least 5 sec. before the intervention.

title: requirment120
description: If the train or the shunting movement exceeds the permitted ceiling speed by a certain harmonised margin, the trainborne equipment shall execute a brake intervention until the actual speed does not exceed permitted speed; then the driver shall be able to release the brake

title: requirment121
description: The driver shall be able to release an ETCS emergency brake application when stationary.

title: requirment122
description: If decided by a national value, the driver may release the ETCS emergency brake when the actual speed is below the permitted speed.

title: requirment123
description: To protect a traction unit from roll away and unwanted reverse movements the trainborne equipment shall monitor the direction of movement in relation to the permitted direction.

title: requirment124
description: The trainborne equipment shall apply the emergency brake after a distance, defined by a national value, is travelled by the train.

title: requirment125
description: The roll away/reverse movement intervention shall be indicated on the DMI.

title: requirment126
description: When the traction unit has come to a standstill, the driver shall be able to release the emergency brake.

title: requirment127
description: After releasing the emergency brake ETCS will provide the supervision appertaining when roll away protection was initiated

title: requirment128
description: When using more than one traction unit this function shall be disabled in all but the leading traction unit.

title: requirment129
description: All data entered, received or indicated to the driver shall be recorded onboard. All data shall be related to UTC (Universal Time Corrected) and a reference point.

title: requirment130
description: Information shall be recorded to an accuracy which enables a clear view of the functioning of ETCS and way the traction unit has been driven.

title: requirment131
description: Standardised output interfaces shall enable transmission of information recorded to other media for investigation

title: requirment132
description:
The retention period for the recorded data will be different and two levels are foreseen:

Data to enable investigation of accidents need only be stored for at least 24 hours, and shall be very detailed.
Operational data to enable assessment of driver performance shall be stored for at least one week.

title: requirment133
description:
The following information shall be recorded:

any transition of Level and of operational status
the driver's confirmation of transition to shunting
train supervision data and information received from national train control systems
actual speed
full service brake intervention
emergency brake intervention
applying the train trip function
selection of the override control
override of the route suitability function
isolation of on board ETCS equipmen
data entered, recieved or indicated to the driver

title: requirment134
description: It shall be possible to use multiple traction units without isolating the ETCS trainborne equipment on traction unit(s) with an in-operative cab.

title: requirment135
description: Information received shall not influence the traction unit(s) with in-operative cabs.

title: requirment136
description: The train trip function 4.6.12 shall be suppressed in traction unit(s) with in-operative cabs.

title: requirment137
description: It shall be possible to use tandem traction units without isolating the ETCS trainborne equipment on the tandem traction unit.

title: requirment138
description: The train trip function 4.6.12 shall be suppressed on the tandem traction unit.

title: requirment139
description: The driver shall enter the driver ID

title: requirment140
description: It shall be possible to drive the train backwards in a supervised way (speed and distance) according to information received from trackside

title: requirment141
description: The train speed shall be at or below a speed specified by a national value.

title: requirment142
description: The driver shall select an override control according to the permission received.

title: requirment143
description: The override control shall be protected against inadvertent operation.

title: requirment144
description: When the train passes the stop signal, the train trip function shall be suppressed.

title: requirment145
description: Actual speed shall still be shown on the DMI.

title: requirment146
description: A special indication shall be shown on the DMI.

title: requirment147
description: The supervised speed shall not be shown on the DMI.

title: requirment148
description: The train shall be capable of receiving any track-to-train information intended and relevant for this train including movement authority.

title: requirment149
description: If supervised by an RBC it shall be possible to command an emergency stop to all trains in a particular area or to a specific train

title: requirment150
description: It shall be possible to command an immediate train stop.

title: requirment151
description: It shall be possible to command a conditional emergency stop. If the train has already passed the location for the emergency stop the command shall be ignored

title: requirment152
description: When a train has received an emergency stop ETCS shall command the emergency brake.

title: requirment153
description: The emergency stop shall be indicated to the driver on the DMI.

title: requirment154
description: It shall be possible to prevent a train from entering a route for which it does not meet the required criteria.

title: requirment155
description: Route unsuitability shall be indicated on the DMI.

title: requirment156
description: The driver shall be able to override the function when the train is stationary.

title: requirment157
description: After overriding this function the movement authority shall be re-established.

title: requirment158
description: When a traction unit passes a stop-signal the emergency brake shall be triggered.

title: requirment159
description: Operation of the train trip shall be indicated on the DMI.

title: requirment160
description: The emergency brake shall be applied until the traction unit is stationary.

title: requirment161
description: When the traction unit is stationary the driver shall be required to acknowledge the train trip condition. This acknowledgement will release the emergency brake.

title: requirment162
description: After the acknowledgement the driver shall be able to continue the movement

title: requirment163
description: After the acknowledgement the train shall be able to be driven backwards for a certain distance defined by national value

title: requirment164
description: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall transmit its own train identification to the RBC.

title: requirment165
description: The train running number shall consist of a maximum of 8 numeric digits.

title: requirment166
description: On demand, the position of the front end of the train at the time of the demand shall be indicated on the DMI. This shall be possible while the train is moving or stationary.

title: requirment167
description: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving information about pantograph and power supply from the trackside.

title: requirment168
description: The ETCS trainborne equipment shall indicate on the DMI the information regarding pantograph and power supply.

title: requirment169
description: The information regarding lowering and raising of the pantograph and opening/closing of the circuit breaker shall be provided separately and in combinations.

title: requirment170
description: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving information regarding air tightness from the trackside.

title: requirment171
description: It shall be possible to send plain text messages from track to train.

title: requirment172
description: When the plain text message appears on the DMI, the driver shall be alerted.

title: requirment173
description: The onboard equipment shall display plain text messages as received.

title: requirment174
description: The character set used shall support different languages.

title: requirment175
description: It shall be possible to send fixed text messages from track to train

title: requirment176
description: Fixed text messages shall be provided in the language selected by the driver

title: requirment177
description:
It shall be possible to send information regarding the inhibition of the following different types of brake:

Regenerative brake
Eddy current brake
Magnetic shoe brake

title: requirment178
description: Information shall be shown on the DMI

title: requirment179
description: The ETCS on-board shall be capable of sending to the trackside train integrity information detected by a system outside ETCS

title: requirment180
description: The driver shall be able to confirm the train integrity to the RBC manually. The confirmation requires the train to be stationary.

title: requirment181
description: The on board shall be capable of sending train data to the trackside after confirmation by the driver, or when entering the RBC area

title: requirment182
description:
The following train data shall be sent from the on board to the trackside:
	
Train running number
STM ready for use
train gauge
Max. axle load
status of air tight system
type of el. power accepted
international train category
max. train speed
train length

title: requirment183
description: It shall be possible to revoke a Movement Authority that has already been issued to a train in a co-operative way between RBC and train.

title: requirment184
description: The co-operative revocation of the MA shall be possible to a new target location, proposed from RBC.

title: requirment185
description: The new target location shall be checked for acceptance by the on board.

title: requirment186
description: If a train cannot stop at the proposed new target location it shall reject the request and keep the old target location.

title: requirment187
description: The Reversing function shall only be possible in one active cab which is not closed at any time during the procedure.

title: requirment188
description: Reversing shall be possible as defined by a value given with the MA

title: requirment189
description: The driver shall be able to use the Reversing function without needing to re-confirm the train data.

title: requirment190
description: Reversing shall be supervised to a distance and speed set as National Values

title: requirment191
description: The distance supervised can be extended from the trackside.

title: requirment192
description: Once the train starts reversing the MA shall be cancelled.

title: requirment193
description: The train shall be able to automatically pass from one RBC area to another without driver intervention.

title: requirment194
description: If the train is equipped with two operational radios there shall be no performance penalty as a result of a transition from one RBC to another (train spacing and train speed).

title: requirment195
description: If the train is equipped with only one operational radio, passing from one RBC to another shall still be possible but might result in a performance penalty.

title: requirment196
description:
In the event of a Transmission Failure the following reactions, shall be capable of being applied in accordance with a National Value:
	
Option 1. The ETCS trainborne equipment shall immediately command the emergency brake. The failure shall be shown on the DMI.
Option 2. The ETCS trainborne equipment shall immediately command the full service brake. The failure shall be shown on the DMI.
Option 3. The train may proceed unrestricted to the end of its movement authority. The indication on the DMI shall remain, and the driver shall be informed about the loss of transmission.

title: requirment197
description: If there are failures of the trainborne equipment which compromise the safety of train supervision, the ETCS trainborne equipment shall immediately command the brake and bring the train to a stop.

title: requirment198
description: The occurrence of a failure shall be displayed on the DMI.

title: requirment199
description: In ETCS with RBC this restriction on performance shall, if possible be transmitted to the RBC.
